DataElement.preferredName: Hepatic Artery Infusion Pump Vessels Ligated During Placement Type
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Text term that represents the kind of vessel ligated during hepatic artery infusion pump (HAIP) placement.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Hepatic Artery Infusion Pump Blood Vessel Ligation During Placement
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A pump designed to administer chemotherapy directly to the liver via the hepatic artery._A tube through which the blood circulates in the body.  Blood vessels include a network of arteries, arterioles, capillaries, venules, and veins._The process of tying off blood vessels so that blood cannot flow to a part of the body or to a tumor._At some point in a given period of time._The act of putting something into a position or location.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A pump designed to administer chemotherapy directly to the liver via the hepatic artery.

Concepts.definition: A pump designed to adminster chemotherapy directly to the liver via the hepatic artery.

Property.preferredDefinition: A tube through which the blood circulates in the body.  Blood vessels include a network of arteries, arterioles, capillaries, venules, and veins.:The process of tying off blood vessels so that blood cannot flow to a part of the body or to a tumor.:At some point in a given period of time.:The act of putting something into a position or location.

Concepts.definition: A tubular structure through which the blood circulates in the body. Blood vessels constitute a network composed of arteries, arterioles, capillaries, venules, and veins.
The process of tying off blood vessels so that blood cannot flow to a part of the body or to a tumor.
At some point in a given period of time.
The act of putting something into a position or location.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Tests, examinations, evaluations used to determine a subject's status or response to intervention.
ConceptualDomain.changeDescription: Created initially to support CCR value domain for CTMS.

ValueDomain.preferredName: Liver or Gastric Blood Vessel Type
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Being or located on or directed toward the side of the body to the east when facing north.: Either of two veins (left gastric and right gastric) that drain blood away from the stomach and lesser curvature.

Concepts.definition: Being or located on or directed toward the side of the body to the east when facing north.
Either of two veins (left gastric and right gastric) that drain blood away from the stomach and lesser curvature.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The act of removing one thing and putting another thing in its place.: Being or located on or directed toward the side of the body to the west when facing north.: The blood vessels that drain blood from the central veins of the liver into the inferior vena cava.

Concepts.definition: The act of removing one thing and putting another thing in its place.
Being or located on or directed toward the side of the body to the west when facing north.
The blood vessels that drain blood from the central veins of the liver into the inferior vena cava.

Concepts.definition: Being or located on or directed toward the side of the body to the west when facing north.
The blood vessels that drain blood from the central veins of the liver into the inferior vena cava.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Being or located on or directed toward the side of the body to the west when facing north.: A short thick trunk vein that transports blood containing the absorbed products of digestion from the intestine directly to the liver.

Concepts.definition: Being or located on or directed toward the side of the body to the west when facing north.
A short thick trunk vein that transports blood containing the absorbed products of digestion from the intestine directly to the liver.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: An intermediate part or section; an area that is approximately central within some larger region.: The blood vessels that drain blood from the central veins of the liver into the inferior vena cava.
